thread.title: Gucci Mane Starts 1017 Eskimo Records & Signs Ralo As First Artist
thread.title_full: Gucci Mane Starts 1017 Eskimo Records & Signs Ralo As First Artist

author: Victoria Hernandez
title: Gucci Mane Starts 1017 Eskimo Records & Signs Ralo As First Artist
text:
A photo posted by Gucci Mane (@laflare1017) on Feb 12, 2017 at 1:40pm PST 
Ralo reposted the announcement and shared his thoughts about partnering with Guwop in a press release. 
“I’m excited about the deal with Gucci because I’ve never had a father figure or a big brother in my life,” the 22-year-old rapper said. “I’ve been looking for this role model because I’ve always had my own operation. I know that Gucci is gonna guide me in the right direction with the music, and so getting his guidance was important in making this decision over other offers I had on the table.” A photo posted by #RALOLAFLARE (@ralofamgoon) on Feb 12, 2017 at 1:48pm PST 
For Gucci Mane, who is preparing the release of his Droptop Wizop album, 1017 Eskimo Records comes after he established his 1017 Brick Squad Records in 2007. That label found success with Waka Flocka Flame , Peewee Longway and OJ Da Juiceman. 
Ralo has also just released his Famerican Gangster 2 mixtape. The 16-track project features Future on the single “ My Brothers ,” as well as Gucci Mane, 21 Savage, Young Thug, Birdman, YFN Lucci and Lil Uzi Vert. Production comes from Zaytoven , Frank Forbes, Cassius Jay and Staxx. 
Ralo’s Famerican Gangster 2 mixtape stream, cover art and tracklist are below. The Dopeman f. YFN Lucci (Intro) (Prod. Zaytoven) Brotherhood (Prod. Staxx) Calm Down Ralo (Prod. Loby Lucci) How Could You (Prod. Beatmonster Marc) They Can’t Stop Us f. Gucci Mane (Prod. Ricky Racks) My Brothers f. Future I Hope It Dont Jam f. 21 Savage & Shy Glizzy (Prod. Cassius Jay) Rico Act (Prod. Yoksten) Came From The Bottom (Prod. Staxx) Love It (Prod. BCSG) Young N*gga f. Young Thug, Lil Uzi, & Lil Yachty (Prod. Ricky Racks) They Aint Believe Us f. Skool Boi (Prod. Frank Forbes) Tell Em f. Birdman & Dae Dae (Prod. Goose) Homage (Prod. BCSG) Ralo Escobar (Outro) (Prod.
